abstract: SUNY Levin Institute in Manhattan report says that as international trade has accelerated in the last four decades, no state has lost more of its ability to manufacture goods or gained more through exporting ideas and professional services than New York; report finds that New York City and its suburbs have reaped most of the rewards of globalization, while some regions of the state failed to adapt to onslaught of competition.
snippet: The costs and benefits of globalization have spread unevenly across New York State, with the city and its suburbs reaping most of the rewards, a report finds.
lead_paragraph: The costs and benefits of globalization have spread unevenly across New York State, with the city and its suburbs reaping most of the rewards, a report finds.

headline.main: Report Lays Out State’s Great Gains and Losses From Globalization
headline.print_headline: Report Lays Out State’s Great Gains and Losses From Globalization
headline.seo: Report Details Globalization Effects in New York
